docs.text: Welcome to Booky For source code visit booky web and booky-service . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to Booky

docs.text: For source code visit booky web and booky-service .

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Introduction Booky is a web application to generate short URLs for any URLs and to bookmark them in groups. Markdown is a lightweight markup language based on the formatting conventions that people naturally use in email.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Booky is a web application to generate short URLs for any URLs and to bookmark them in groups. Markdown is a lightweight markup language based on the formatting conventions that people naturally use in email.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Security The applcaition uses Google OAuth2 feature. User can sign in the application using their gmail account and Booky will treat them as valid users.
docs.title: Security

docs.text: The applcaition uses Google OAuth2 feature. User can sign in the application using their gmail account and Booky will treat them as valid users.
